tasks.task: Perform reproductive work in a farming or agricultural setting, likely involving tasks such as insemination, handling livestock, or managing breeding programs.
subtasks: Approach and restrain livestock for reproductive procedures.
Administer insemination using appropriate equipment.
Monitor and record breeding dates and other relevant data.
Prepare and maintain breeding equipment.
Administer necessary treatments or medications.
Ensure proper animal welfare during procedures.
Clean and sterilize equipment after use.
Transport livestock to and from breeding areas.

tasks.task: Engage in livestock handling, which is a critical part of reproductive work.
subtasks: Herd or guide livestock to and from various areas, such as pens, pastures, or treatment areas.
Load and unload livestock onto transport vehicles.
Inspect livestock for signs of distress or health issues during handling.
Use appropriate tools and equipment for safe handling (e.g., leads, halter, restraining equipment).

tasks.task: Clean and maintain breeding facilities or equipment.
subtasks: Dispose of used supplies and materials properly.
Clean and disinfect equipment, such as insemination tubes or breeding stands.
Restock cleaning supplies and other necessary items.

tasks.task: Observe and document animal behavior and health post-reproductive work.
subtasks: Check for signs of discomfort or injury in recently bred animals.
Document any observed behaviors or health changes in records.
Administer pain relief or treatment if necessary.

tasks.task: Engage in preparation for upcoming breeding seasons.
subtasks: Prepare facilities and equipment for upcoming reproductive cycles.
Ensure that materials and medications are stocked and up-to-date.
Conduct maintenance checks on breeding equipment.

tasks.task: Follow regulatory and ethical guidelines related to livestock breeding.
subtasks: Adhere to laws and regulations regarding animal husbandry.
Follow ethical guidelines for breeding practices.
Keep records of all procedures and treatments for regulatory compliance.
